org.svvrl.goal.core.util

Class Lattice<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.util.Lattice<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements in a lattice

    public class Lattice<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides functions to maintain a lattice. The top and the bottom should be given when constructing a new lattice. In a lattice, an element n is the child of another element m if and only if
    • n ≤ m, and
    • for every other element e in the lattice, it is not the case that n ≤ e and e ≤ m.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lattice

        public Lattice(Order<T> o,
               T t,
               T b)
        Constructs this lattice with a specified partial order, a specified top, and a specified bottom. By default, the top has ID 1 while the bottom has ID 0.
        Parameters:
        o - a partial order
        t - the top of this lattice
        b - the bottom of this lattice

        Returns:
        the number of parallel insertions

      • setParallelComparisons

        public void setParallelComparisons(int i)
        Sets the maximum number of parallel comparisons between the element to be inserted and the children of the currently visiting element. The parallel comparisons would be useful if the cost of a comparison is high and there is little redundancy among the elements to be inserted.
        Parameters:
        i - the maximum number of parallel comparisons between the element to be inserted and the children of the currently visiting element

      • getParallelComparisons

        public int getParallelComparisons()
        Returns the maximum number of parallel comparisons between the element to be inserted and the children of the currently visiting element.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of the parallel comparisons between the element to be inserted and the children of the currently visiting element

      • removeNode

        protected void removeNode(T n)
        Simply removes a specified element from this lattice. Some missing edges from the parents of the removed element to the children of the removed element will not be inserted in this method.
        Parameters:
        n - an element to be removed from this lattice.

      • testIntegerSet

        public static void testIntegerSet(int max,
                                  int num,
                                  int round,
                                  boolean validate)
        Tests the lattice functions by inserting sets of integers. The top will be {0, 1, …, max - 1}.
        Parameters:
        max - the number of integers in the top
        num - the number of sets to be inserted in a round
        round - the number of rounds in a test
        validate - indicating if the constructed lattice should be validated or not

      • testFSA

        public static void testFSA(int nprops,
                           int nstates,
                           AlphabetType atype,
                           int num,
                           int pi,
                           int pc)
        Tests the lattice functions by inserting Büchi automata.
        Parameters:
        nprops - the number of atomic propositions or classical symbols
        nstates - the number of states of a Büchi automaton to be inserted
        atype - the type of the alphabet of the Büchi automata to be inserted
        num - the number of Büchi automata to be inserted
        pi - the number of parallel insertions
        pc - the number of parallel comparisons
